macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Tariffs Cancelled, Tech Stocks Lead Market Rally
items.summary: The cancellation of US tariffs boosted equity markets, with the Nasdaq leading gains as Google, Amazon, and Meta surged. The S&P 500 reversed its bearish outlook and climbed back above 6,900, though the Dow and defensive equities lagged due to concerns about US manufacturing impact.[1]

items.title: S&P 500 Gains 0.32%, Approaches All-Time Highs
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose to 6,884 points, gaining 0.32% on the session. Bulls are targeting the 2-hour 200-moving average at 6,904 as key resistance, with potential for further rallies toward all-time highs if this level breaks.[1][3]

items.title: Fed Official Signals Possible Near-Term Rate Cut
items.summary: New York Fed President John Williams indicated that a near-term rate cut remains possible as labor market weakness poses greater risk than elevated inflation. Markets now price in approximately 69% probability of a 25 basis point rate reduction in December.[3]

items.title: First Majestic Silver Surges 10% on Record Earnings
items.summary: First Majestic Silver jumped nearly 10% after posting record fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results, with quarterly revenue surging 169% year-over-year to $463.9 million and silver production jumping 77% to 4.2 million ounces.[2]

items.title: TSX Hits Record High on Commodity Strength and Earnings
items.summary: The S&P/TSX Composite Index climbed 205 points (0.6%) to a new record high of 33,595, driven by firm commodity prices, robust US manufacturing data, and better-than-expected corporate earnings. Mining, energy, and technology sectors led gains.[2]

items.title: US Stocks Underperforming Global Equities by 31-Year Margin
items.summary: US stocks are underperforming global equities by the widest margin in 31 years so far in 2026. The S&P 500 has returned 18.4% since January 1, 2025, compared with 44.8% for international equities, driven by currency movements, geopolitical shifts, and valuation disparities.[4]

items.title: Market Concentration Risk Remains Manageable Despite Valuation Gap
items.summary: While the S&P 500 trades at a forward P/E of 22x, the Equal Weight index trades at 17x, reflecting record concentration with top-10 holdings accounting for 41.2% of the index. Smart money is rotating into undervalued sectors including Industrials, Energy, and Financials.[5]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum Post Worst Year-to-Date Start in a Decade Amid Market Divergence
items.summary: Bitcoin is down nearly 24% year-to-date to around $67,000, and Ethereum has dropped about 24% to $2,000, marking the worst starts in a decade despite modest Friday gains. Analysts like those at Bitwise and Fundstrat see signs of a potential rebound as crypto fundamentals strengthen.

items.title: Bitcoin Forecast Predicts Test of $68,605 Resistance Followed by Decline to Below $52,305
items.summary: Analysts forecast Bitcoin attempting a bullish correction to test resistance near $68,605 before a downward rebound targeting below $52,305, confirmed by RSI signals and triangle pattern dynamics. A breakout above $74,665 could invalidate the bearish outlook and target $78,575.

items.title: Bitcoin Daily Chart Signals Bigger Price Move Imminent
items.summary: February Bitcoin futures remain steady in early U.S. trading on February 20, with technical analyst Jim Wyckoff alerting to a bigger price move coming soon based on daily chart patterns.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: U.S. Department of Defense Prioritizes AI with $66 Billion IT Budget Request
items.summary: The U.S. Department of Defense has requested $66 billion in IT spending for fiscal 2026, a $1.8 billion increase from the prior year, with artificial intelligence designated as the top priority across all service branches.

items.title: Global AI in Defense and Aerospace Market Projected to Reach $42.8 Billion by 2036
items.summary: A new industry forecast projects the global AI in defense and aerospace market will experience tenfold expansion from $4.2 billion to $42.8 billion by 2036, driven by autonomous systems and real-time intelligence processing.

items.title: Archer Aviation Unveils AI-Powered Aviation Technologies Using NVIDIA IGX Thor
items.summary: Archer Aviation announced plans to develop next-generation AI technologies for aviation at CES 2026, focusing on real-time sensor fusion for pilot awareness, predictive health monitoring, and autonomy-ready flight controls using NVIDIA's IGX Thor platform.

items.title: Machine Learning Achieves 99% Accuracy in Predicting Pursuit-Evasion Network Dynamics
items.summary: Researchers have developed machine learning models that predict the 'cop number' in pursuit-evasion games on networks with 99% accuracy, offering scalable solutions to a computationally challenging problem that has resisted easy solutions for decades.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: MADE IN JAPAN 2026 Collection Launches on Steam
items.summary: The Japan External Trade Organization (JETRO) announced that the MADE IN JAPAN COLLECTION 2026 is now live on Steam, featuring Japanese-developed games.

items.title: 'Stop Killing Games' Campaign Gains Momentum on Preservation in US and EU
items.summary: The Stop Killing Games initiative expresses optimism about success in pushing for game preservation laws in the US and EU to prevent games from becoming unplayable.

items.title: Midsummer Studios, Led by Jake Solomon, Shuts Down
items.summary: Midsummer Studios, founded by Firaxis veteran Jake Solomon, has closed its doors, ending development on its ambitious life sim project.

items.title: Surge in Memory Prices Threatens Games Industry Margins
items.summary: Rising memory prices are impacting the games industry, with thin margins on console hardware highlighted by Sony's recent PS5 discounting reports.

items.title: Top US Game Sales for January 2026: Call of Duty Black Ops 7 Leads
items.summary: Video game software spending rose 3% to $4.3 billion in January 2026, led by Call of Duty Black Ops 7; new entry Code Vein II debuted at #11, while Final Fantasy VII Remake surged due to new ports.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Vestwell Doubles Valuation with $385M Series E Funding
items.summary: Fintech company Vestwell has doubled its valuation after raising $385 million in a Series E funding round. This investment highlights growing interest in retirement tech solutions.

items.title: Stripe's Bridge Secures Conditional OCC Approval for National Trust Bank Charter
items.summary: Stripe's Bridge has received conditional approval from the OCC for a national trust bank charter, advancing its infrastructure ambitions in payments and banking. This move positions Stripe to expand its financial services offerings.

items.title: PSR Fines Bank of Ireland UK £3.7M Over CoP Implementation Delay
items.summary: The Payment Systems Regulator has fined Bank of Ireland UK £3.7 million for delaying implementation of Confirmation of Payee measures. The fine addresses failures in fraud prevention compliance.

items.title: Former Uber Exec Tristan Kirchner Named CEO of ClearBank's European Operations
items.summary: Tristan Kirchner, a former Uber executive, has been appointed as CEO of ClearBank's European operations. This leadership change aims to drive expansion in the European banking-as-a-service market.

items.title: Citigroup Reiterates Buy Rating on Microsoft Amid Market Dip
items.summary: Analysts at Citigroup maintained a buy rating on Microsoft, citing decade-low valuations and a discount to the S&P 500. The recommendation encourages buying the dip despite broader market pressures.
